newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Karaoke girls' wings clipped in Vietnam.
newsitem.headline: Karaoke girls' wings clipped in Vietnam.

text.p: Karaoke bars in Ho Chi Minh City, which the Vietnamese authorities believe are a breeding ground for "social evils", have been told their hostesses can no longer sit with clients or even join them in song.
The Thanh Nien newspaper said on Tuesday that the People's Committee had temporarily halted the issue of licences for karaoke bars in the city ahead of an official "reorganisation".
Many karaoke bars double as "bia om", or hugging bars, where hostesses are said to offer more than liquid refreshment.
Thanh Nien said a network of stores renting videos, which have already come under scrutiny as part of a blitz on blue movies, would also be revised.
The communist government launched a nationwide campaign against "social evils" earlier this year, targeting pornography, prostitution, drug-abuse and gambling.
Formerly known as Saigon, freewheeling Ho Chi Minh City gained a reputation as a den of pimps and prostitution during the Vietnam War.
